Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can draw basic features of a land habitat, like simple outlines of trees and a few scattered bushes.
The student can attempt to draw a basic water habitat, including a body of water with simple fish shapes.
The student can illustrate some types of living things in the land habitat, such as basic trees and possibly a couple of simple bugs.
CANNOT: The student may not include a wide variety of living things in the land habitat, like diverse plant and animal life. (student doesn't include diversity)
The student may draw water habitats without accurate representation, like only focusing on water with no surrounding environment. (student misunderstands habitat complexity)

The student is likely unable to compare and show different living things accurately in both habitats, possibly depicting the same types of animals in both land and water. (student doesn't compare habitats clearly)
The student may struggle to depict patterns of diversity effectively, possibly using the same few living things in both habitats. (student shows limited range in living organisms)
